DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study is to see whether patients with chronic smell impairment after brain injury benefit from a treatment that consists of corticosteroids, and then olfactory training in 3 months.
DOC.brief_title: Olfaction Disorders in Patients Included in The Trauma Brain Injury (TBI) Database at Trondheim University Hospital
DOC.criteria: Registered in the TBI Database 1865 years of age per 01.10. 2012 Olfaction score by Sniffin Sticks ThresholdDiscriminationIdentification (TDI) < 30 confirming dysosmia Unable to express senses. Unable to follow treatment and protocol pregnancy diabetes tendency to infections hypertonia dyspepsia interfering medication (hormonal treatment, NSAIDS, antidiabetics, barbiturates, fenitoin, carbamazepin, rifampicin, cyclophosphamides)
